title: إِعْرَاب الجُمَل
description: Learn about إعراب الجمل, how entire sentences can occupy grammatical positions like خبر، حال، صفة، and when sentences have محل من الإعراب.

notes.title: Sentences with Grammatical Position
notes.titleArabic: الجمل التي لها محل من الإعراب
content: In Arabic, entire sentences can occupy grammatical positions. When a sentence stands in place of a noun, it has محل من الإعراب (a grammatical position).
Seven types of sentences have محل: خبرية، حالية، مفعولية، مضاف إليه، جواب الشرط المقترن بالفاء، التابعة لما له محل، والمحكية.
keyPoints: Sentences can function as nouns in grammar
These sentences have محل (position) - رفع، نصب، or جر
The sentence replaces what would be a single noun
Not all sentences have محل - some have لا محل لها

examples.english: The student studies (predicate sentence - محل رفع)
He came while laughing (circumstantial - محل نصب)
He said, 'I am going' (object of saying - محل نصب)
I came the day you traveled (genitive - محل جر)

notes.title: Predicate Sentences (الجملة الخبرية)
content: When a sentence serves as the خبر (predicate) of a مبتدأ, إنّ, or كان, it occupies the position of خبر.
الطَّالِبُ يَجْتَهِدُ - the sentence يَجْتَهِدُ is the خبر of الطَّالِبُ, so it's في محل رفع خبر المبتدأ.
keyPoints: خبر المبتدأ: الطَّالِبُ يَدْرُسُ → في محل رفع
خبر إنّ: إِنَّ الطَّالِبَ يَدْرُسُ → في محل رفع
خبر كان: كَانَ الطَّالِبُ يَدْرُسُ → في محل نصب
Can be verbal or nominal sentence

examples.english: Knowledge is a light that illuminates the path

notes.title: Circumstantial Sentences (الجملة الحالية)
content: A sentence that describes the state/condition of the subject or object is called الجملة الحالية. It's في محل نصب حال.
جَاءَ الطَّالِبُ وَهُوَ يَبْتَسِمُ (The student came while smiling) - وَهُوَ يَبْتَسِمُ describes his state.
keyPoints: Describes the state of صاحب الحال
Answers: كَيْفَ جَاءَ؟ (How did he come?)

examples.english: I saw him reading (state of him)
He came while the sun was rising

notes.title: Adjectival Sentences (الجملة الواقعة صفة)
content: A sentence can describe an indefinite noun, functioning as an adjective (صفة/نعت). It follows the noun's case.
مَرَرْتُ بِرَجُلٍ يَقْرَأُ (I passed by a man reading) - يَقْرَأُ describes رَجُل and is في محل جر صفة.
keyPoints: Takes the case of the described noun
رَأَيْتُ رَجُلًا يَكْتُبُ → في محل نصب صفة
جَاءَ طَالِبٌ يَسْأَلُ → في محل رفع صفة

examples.english: I saw a student who strives
I passed by a house whose doors were open
A man carrying a book came
This is a book We revealed

exercises.prompt: الطَّالِبُ يَدْرُسُ - جملة يدرس في محل _____ خبر
exercises.promptEn: The student studies - the sentence 'studies' is in the position of _____ (predicate)

exercises.prompt: جَاءَ وَهُوَ يَضْحَكُ - جملة الحال في محل _____
exercises.promptEn: He came laughing - the circumstantial sentence is in the position of _____

exercises.prompt: رَأَيْتُ رَجُلًا يَكْتُبُ - جملة الصفة في محل _____
exercises.promptEn: I saw a man writing - the adjectival sentence is in the position of _____

exercises.prompt: جِئْتُ يَوْمَ سَافَرْتَ - جملة سافرت في محل _____ مضاف إليه
exercises.promptEn: I came the day you traveled - the sentence is in the position of _____ (genitive)

exercises.prompt: A man carrying a book came
